result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Allen McDaniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: From DOC - Revoked - Sentenced to County Jail/HOC  All costs and fines were paid while on probation - remove judgment.

Defendant Derrick Allen McDaniel in court with attorney Nathan M Cockerham.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions to amend to Misdemeanor Bail Jump 946.4(1)(1) Class A.  Court grants motion to amend.  Adivsed of rights; joint recommendation; parties stipulate to facts;  Defendant pleads NC to amended Ct.1; court finds guilty and convicts on amended Ct. 1.  Sentence: 9 months Sawyer county jail with huber; consecutive to 14CF72; credit for 89 days toward conditional jail time and underlying sentence; IMPOSED & STAYED; 2 years probation concurrent to 14CF72; conditions of probation: 90 days County Jail with huber 89 days credit; consecutive to 14CF72 beginning 05-08-15 prior to 3:00 p.m.; No Contact with John Butler; any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; court costs totaling $443.00.  Forward bond money to DOC to be applied toward restitution on 14CF72.  Appeal rights; report to probation and parole today; plea questionnaire filed.
Defendant Derrick A. McDaniel in court in custody at the Bayfield County Jail by video with attorney Nathan M Cockerham.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OFF Record.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, and wishes to contact counsel (will need to contact Public Defender's office to retain a lawyer).  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
